timeline.bodyText: So, the caller of this method will know to retry on the blobs that are not in the returned list?
timeline.author: cgtz

replies.bodyText: Right.  They will be returned by the Cosmos query on the next compaction run (since we are not deleting those records).
replies.author: lightningrob

timeline.bodyText: Apparently, the client will throw a general RuntimeException (looking at the code its IllegalStateException) and not BlobStorageException if it times out. We should make sure that the callers are prepared to handle that. It may be worth documenting in the javadocs too.
timeline.author: cgtz

replies.bodyText: Good point.  I  think it's okay to let the RuntimeException be thrown, but will add to the javadoc.
